extendedIngredients.name: cherry tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup grape or small cherry tomatoes

extendedIngredients.name: seasoning blend
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 tablespoons Gourmet Gardens Italian Herbs or your favorite Italian seasoning blend

extendedIngredients.name: fresh garlic
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon Gourmet Gardens Garlic or fresh minced garlic

recipes.title: Tilapia with Italian Herbs

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Chateau Ste. Michelle Pinot Gris. It has 4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 13 dollars.

productMatches.title: Chateau Ste. Michelle Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Mild winter and spring weather continued into a long, warm, dry and stable growing season in 2001. September harvest conditions were ideal with very warm, clear days and cool nights."Fresh pear, honeydew melon and mandarin orange aromas and flavors combine with chamomile tea, honeysuckle and assorted floral characteristics..." according to winemaker, Erik Olsen. This wine pairs well with shellfish, cream-based dishes, cheese & fruit.

recipes.instructions: Heat 1 teaspoon Olive oil in a large skilletAdd mushrooms and cook 4 minutes to release liquidAdd tomatoes and garlic, cook 5 minutes or until tomatoes softenAdd peas, cover and cook 5 minutes or until peas are bright green and tenderStir in green onions, remove vegetables to a plate, keep warmCoat tilapia evenly on both sides with Italian herbsHeat remaining Olive oil in pan, add fish and cook on each side 3 minutesServe with warm vegetables

steps.step: Heat 1 teaspoon Olive oil in a large skillet
Add mushrooms and cook 4 minutes to release liquid
Add tomatoes and garlic, cook 5 minutes or until tomatoes soften
Add peas, cover and cook 5 minutes or until peas are bright green and tender
Stir in green onions, remove vegetables to a plate, keep warm
Coat tilapia evenly on both sides with Italian herbs
Heat remaining Olive oil in pan, add fish and cook on each side 3 minutes
